attributes.action: lower the court costs for local authorities to apply for protection for children at risk
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is now more expensive by up to 2,500% for a local authority to apply to a court to have a child on the at risk register removed to a place of safety.

Increases in funding to local councils do not cover this rise, and it is a deterrent to saving exactly those they are meant to be saving - at risk children.

These costs must be reviewed and lowered so cost is never a factor in such terrible cases as with Baby P

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "lower the court costs for local authorities to apply for protection for children at risk."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here:
